comments.body: Interesting. So the library building isn't in `make all`? Also, I am guessing we are building static and shared libraries here. Is that correct?

> So the library building isn't in `make all`

Last time I checked no. I have to re-visit upstream to see if there is any improvements.

> Also, I am guessing we are building static and shared libraries here. Is that correct?

Correct.

@jakirkham 

Yes (static and shared libs).

In the early days of me using these libraries, the incantations make everything link properly involved a little bit of magic, making sure the handles of the pots and pans in your kitchen were pointed north, and a little bit of luck. 

Unfortunately, `autoconf`, configure scripts, etc, are very much a black box to me. What you see above is the first procedure I found that reliable built everything. One it worked, I left it alone.

In short, this was me flailing around until everything worked.

Alright, I trust you guys have spent enough time flailing around. :wink:
Just asking for my own edification. :smile:
@phobson you took this farther than most of the previous users.  That is good enough to me!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@make
make lib
make shlib
make tests
make install
